newsitem.title: UK: UK NTC April consumer indicator rises to record.
newsitem.headline: UK NTC April consumer indicator rises to record.

text.p: The NTC consumer industries' leading indicator rose to 108.4, its highest ever level, in April from 108.2 in March, NTC Economic and Financial Research said.
It was the fourth successive monthly rise.

"The continuing upward trend in the indicator is suggesting further consumer driven economic growth over the course of the next year," NTC said, adding that the indicator tends to move ahead of the economic cycle by 11 months.

The strongest upward pressure came from tighter labour market conditions, improved consumer confidence, significant growth in the output of consumer goods industries and continued strength in retail sales growth.
